ygData.subject: Re: Marriage
ygData.msgSnippet: I am 27 and I have an on-line love in the game too.  We are both firmly aware of the person behind the character.  He is a man with 2 kids and a wife.  I am
ygData.messageBody:
I am 27 and I have an on-line "love" in the game too. We are both
firmly aware of the person behind the character. He is a man with 2
kids and a wife. I am a woman with a husband. We are just
role-playing our characters.
Sometimes I still feel a bit "wrong" about our flirtation, but really,
I know there is nothing to it and we live in totally different
countries (he is from Canada). So. I really don't know if I have
helped or not. I say make sure you and he are both aware of the real
person behind the pixels on the screen.


--- Judy Tyrer <judy3t@...> wrote:
> From: Judy Tyrer <judy3t@...>
>
> As my character is marrying on Sunday I must confess
> to a few minor qualms. In
> particular, er, how does one roleplay a honeymoon
> *smile*. Unlike many who
> develop relationships in Norrath, my beloved and I
> are unknown to one another in
> RL. For all I know he weighs 300 pounds, guzzles
> beer, and is hygenically
> challenged *smile*
>
> There are times if I wonder if this is a positive
> thing to be doing. I mean,
> what if he is some starry eyed adolescent and I ruin
> him for life *grin*. I know
> MY lines are clearly drawn in fuzz (okay, I think I
> know the difference between
> reality and fantasy though I swear I saw a Pixie
> Trickster in the airport the
> other day *grin*).
>
> Anyway, this is all fun and games and I am having
> fun. But there is this part in
> the back of my mind that wonders. Because unlike
> reading romance novels (blech -
> persish the thought) there is another person
> involved in my little fantasy and I
> must never forget that.
>
> Any other hard core role players out there struggle
> with these ridiculous
> issues? Any other players over the age of 25, for
> that matter *smile*
>
> Dnaice on Quellious
> Trisango on Brell Serilis
>
>
